To view the recorded GovFuture webinar on Health Mapping (Sept. 26th) visit: https://t.co/5HfiLVXK
Thanks for organizing the tweet up Colleen !  Happy to share thoughts on geospatial mapping for public health #hcsmca
For the CGDI to be leveraged in support of HC in Canada, increased awareness / geospatial literacy, at all levels, is needed  #hcsmca
Fortunately, best practices exist for server based and web based mapping systems, which can be operated at low cost for HC community #hcsmca
Scalability is also a concern, and health IT departments rarely plan for web mapping services and applications. #hcsmca
HC orgs should examine their data and mapping resources, and help identify end-user information needs, for interoperable health SDI #hcsmca
However, health authorities (from local, to provincial, to national) have not yet fully leveraged standard approach to mapping #hcsmca
GeoConnections funded several health and environmental mapping projects which published / consumed geospatial resources in the CGDI #hcsmca
A spatial data infrastructure exists in Canada: the Canadian Geospatial Data Infrastructure http://t.co/vRgPjCiN #hcsmca
Maps can be used to evaluate the effectiveness of our outreach programs, to curb respiratory disease, and to inform local decisions #hcsmca
Open Mapping Standards enable multiple users to access distributed geospatial resources, and re-use them based on individual needs #hcsmca
Using maps, HC practioners can test hypothesis, identify potential spatial correlations, environmental/social determinants, etc  #hcsmca
We mapped respiratory trends in Canada, pollutant and meteorological data, community assets / survey data, and sea level rise #hcsmca
We also have community health programs to address air pollution, climate change and related impacts (e.g. heat events) #hcsmca
I'd be interested in what participants feel are key needs in the HC community. Our organization (@NBLung) concerned with respiratory #hcsmca
User centered design, development, testing, is critical to the success of health mapping applications + spatial data infrastructure #hcsmca
Interoperability is key for cross-border mapping, crucial for responding to novel outbreaks, and annual influenza campaigns #hcsmca
Or keep the health information mapping private and permission-based, for health and emergency management professionals #hcsmca
To map health info across borders, health data providers could use a standard Health 'XML' schema to publish only public data #hcsmca
Agree with @M9atts It depends on the applicable privacy laws, jurisdictional authority (CMOs) and methods used #hcsmca
T3: To protect privacy, strip identifiers, use data licenses, best practices, statistical methods, and service level agreements #hcsmca
T3: privacy is a central issue.  To map thematic health information (e.g. by disease type / population) one must normalize/aggregate #hcsmca
Using open mapping standards we demonstrated the ability to map Asthma, COPD, Emphysema, Lung Cancer at Health Region and DA levels #hcsmca
geospatial literacy means the level of understanding and practice with geographic information and mapping systems #hcsmca
SM can also be used to crowdsource information (Points of Interest) onto a map, overlay with health outcomes (aggregate) #hcsmca
We are in the early adopter phase, with varying levels of adoption of 'mapping' for cancer, other chronic and infectious disease #hcsmca
I think SM can help educate the HC community about low-cost, user-driven, map applications to support public health decision making #hcsmca
Users could zoom to area of interest, turn on weather and pollutant map layers, health map layers, without compromising privacy #hcsmca
Our web map application, enabled public users to find their nearest flu clinic, based on postal code / municipality name #hcsmca
HC practioners can use (OGC compliant) commercial GIS or web applications to visualize geospatial data, HC resources, trends / time #hcsmca
integrating distributed, authoritative data, using open mapping standards can produce thematic maps for HC planning + outbreaks #hcsmca
It is a new topic for many health practitioners.  Using standard approach to map health info and determinants can improve HC #hcsmca
Hi Colleen!  Good afternoon #hcsmca community.  We had a great Webinar this morning with @opengeospatial on mapping for health #hcsmca
